title: Impulse - momentum change from force on cart

content.description: A cart with mass <math alttext="0.25 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.25</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> moves along a straight, horizontal track aligned with the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, as shown in the top figure. The cart is initially moving in the <math alttext="negative x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction with a speed of <math alttext="10 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>. A horizontal force is exerted on the cart in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></mpadded></math>-direction for <math alttext="0.002 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.002</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. The graph shows the magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> of the force as a function of time. Which of the following correctly indicates how the magnitude of the cart’s momentum and the direction of the cart’s momentum have changed, if at all, at the end of the <math alttext="0.002 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.002</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> interval?
content.question: MagnitudeDirectionADecreasedChangedBDecreasedDid not changeCIncreasedChangedDIncreasedDid not change

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
